profile.name: global
profile.desc: The basic set of elements allowed for every object type.
profile.field: Uniquely identifies this item in the database. Identifiers must begin with the contributor namespace, followed by a '.' and then a unique string within that namespace which consists only of the following characters: A-Za-z0-9_:.-
The key field of the parent to which the object belongs.
The key field of a container object for which this object is a group member. Groups are not bound by hierarchy, but should probably not be circular.
An integer >0 designating the relative position (sequence) of this object within its parent container. Numbers do not have to be contiguous (but should be when possible for efficiency).
The name of the application profile for this record.
The unique namespace established for the contributor, usually an ILL code if one exists. It must consist of A-Za-z0-9_.
A descriptive label (e.g. title) that can be used as the standard way to describe or refer to this item.
Like label, but used in the context of the parent item. For example, this could be a page number for a page record or a volume/issue number for an issue in a serial.

The earliest publication year for this object. If the object describes a series of items, this should be the publication date of the earliest item. For items with uncertain dates, this is the lowest estimated date.
The latest publication year for this object. See pubmin for more information.
Language of the content of this object. Should be a lower-case international language code (en, fr, etc.).
Material type description. Should be taken from a controlled list, with values like "text," "audio," etc.
Content type description. Should be taken from a controlled list, with values like "speech," "dictionary," "diary," etc.
